sn23.1:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā rādho yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.1:1.2.eng: Then Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn23.1:2.1.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra’.
sn23.1:2.1.comm: For Māra’s mythic history, see SN 4.1:2.1. Early Buddhist texts present Māra as both a deity of ill intent, and as a metaphor for the death, desire, and entrapment in the world of transmigration. This discourse highlights the literal meaning of his name: Death.

sn23.1:2.3.pli: “Rūpe kho, rādha, sati māro vā assa māretā vā yo vā pana mīyati.
sn23.1:2.3.eng: “When there is form, Rādha, there would be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
sn23.1:2.3.comm: Here we could translate Māra as “murder”.

sn23.1:2.4.pli: Tasmātiha tvaṃ, rādha, rūpaṃ māroti passa, māretāti passa, mīyatīti passa, rogoti passa, gaṇḍoti passa, sallanti passa, aghanti passa, aghabhūtanti passa.
sn23.1:2.4.eng: So you should see form as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the boil, the dart, the gloom, the gloominess.

sn23.1:2.5.pli: Ye naṃ evaṃ passanti te sammā passanti.
sn23.1:2.5.eng: Those who see it like this see rightly.

sn23.1:2.9.pli: viññāṇe sati māro vā assa māretā vā yo vā pana mīyati.
sn23.1:2.9.eng: consciousness, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.

sn23.1:2.10.pli: Tasmātiha tvaṃ, rādha, viññāṇaṃ māroti passa, māretāti passa, mīyatīti passa, rogoti passa, gaṇḍoti passa, sallanti passa, aghanti passa, aghabhūtanti passa.
sn23.1:2.10.eng: So you should see consciousness as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the boil, the dart, the gloom, the gloominess.

sn23.1:2.11.pli: Ye naṃ evaṃ passanti, te sammā passantī”ti.
sn23.1:2.11.eng: Those who see it like this see rightly.”

sn23.1:3.1.eng: “But sir, what’s the purpose of seeing rightly?”

sn23.1:3.2.eng: “Disillusionment is the purpose of seeing rightly.”

sn23.1:3.9.eng: “But sir, what is the purpose of extinguishment?”

sn23.1:3.10.pli: “Accayāsi, rādha, pañhaṃ, nāsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ.
sn23.1:3.10.eng: “Your question goes too far, Rādha. You couldn’t figure out the limit of questions.

sn23.1:3.11.pli: Nibbānogadhañhi, rādha, brahmacariyaṃ vussati, nibbānaparāyanaṃ nibbānapariyosānan”ti.
sn23.1:3.11.eng: For extinguishment is the objective, destination, and culmination of the spiritual life.”
sn23.1:3.11.comm: Ogādha (see gādha at SN 22.56:4.2) is the “firm footing”, reaching which is the “objective” of fording a river. It inhabits the same metaphorical sphere as the “far shore” (pāra) which one safely reaches (MN 34:9.2), and about which the final chapter of the Sutta Nipāta was sung (Snp 5.18:1.4), or the “solid ground” on which the brahmin stands (SN 35.228:2.10). The “far shore”, meanwhile, may also be the parāyana or “destination”.

sn23.10:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ rādhaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
sn23.10:1.2.eng: When Venerable Rādha was seated to one side, the Buddha said to him:

sn23.10:1.3.pli: “rūpe kho, rādha, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, te pajahatha.
sn23.10:1.3.eng: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.

sn23.10:1.4.pli: Evaṃ taṃ rūpaṃ pahīnaṃ bhavissati ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ.
sn23.10:1.4.eng: Thus that form will be given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

sn23.10:1.5.pli: Vedanāya yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, te pajahatha.
sn23.10:1.5.eng: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling …

sn23.10:1.6.pli: Evaṃ sā vedanā pahīnā bhavissati ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

sn23.10:1.8.pli: saṅkhāresu yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, te pajahatha.

sn23.10:1.9.pli: Evaṃ te saṅkhārā pahīnā bhavissanti ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

sn23.10:1.10.pli: Viññāṇe yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, te pajahatha.
sn23.10:1.10.eng: consciousness; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.

sn23.10:1.11.pli: Evaṃ taṃ viññāṇaṃ pahīnaṃ bhavissati ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhamman”ti.
sn23.10:1.11.eng: Thus that consciousness will be given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.”

sn23.11:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.11:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.11:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra’.

sn23.11:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, māro, vedanā māro, saññā māro, saṅkhārā māro, viññāṇaṃ māro.
sn23.11:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form is Māra, feeling is Māra, perception is Māra, choices are Māra, consciousness is Māra.

sn23.11:1.6.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, rādha, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmimpi nibbindati, vedanāyapi nibbindati, saññāyapi nibbindati, saṅkhāresupi nibbindati, viññāṇasmimpi nibbindati.
sn23.11:1.6.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

sn23.11:1.7.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati. Vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn23.11:1.7.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn23.11:1.8.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn23.11:1.8.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.12:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.12:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.12:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘subject to Māra’.

sn23.12:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, māradhammo, vedanā māradhammo, saññā māradhammo, saṅkhārā māradhammo, viññāṇaṃ māradhammo.
sn23.12:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form is subject to Māra. Feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are subject to Māra.

sn23.12:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.13:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.13:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.13:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘impermanence’.

sn23.13:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, aniccaṃ, vedanā aniccā, saññā aniccā, saṅkhārā aniccā, viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ.
sn23.13:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are impermanent.

sn23.13:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.14:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.14:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.14:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘liable to impermanence’.

sn23.14:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, aniccadhammo, vedanā aniccadhammo, saññā aniccadhammo, saṅkhārā aniccadhammo, viññāṇaṃ aniccadhammo.
sn23.14:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to impermanence.

sn23.14:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.15:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.15:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.15:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘suffering’.

sn23.15:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, dukkhaṃ, vedanā dukkhā, saññā dukkhā, saṅkhārā dukkhā, viññāṇaṃ dukkhaṃ.
sn23.15:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are suffering.

sn23.15:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.16:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.16:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.16:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, dukkhadhammo, vedanā dukkhadhammo, saññā dukkhadhammo, saṅkhārā dukkhadhammo, viññāṇaṃ dukkhadhammo.
sn23.16:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to suffering.

sn23.16:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.17:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.17:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.17:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘not-self’.

sn23.17:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, anattā, vedanā anattā, saññā anattā, saṅkhārā anattā, viññāṇaṃ anattā.
sn23.17:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are not-self.

sn23.17:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.18:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.18:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.18:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘liable to not-self’.

sn23.18:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, anattadhammo, vedanā anattadhammo, saññā anattadhammo, saṅkhārā anattadhammo, viññāṇaṃ anattadhammo.
sn23.18:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to not-self.

sn23.18:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.19:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.19:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.19:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, khayadhammo, vedanā khayadhammo, saññā khayadhammo, saṅkhārā khayadhammo, viññāṇaṃ khayadhammo.
sn23.19:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to end.

sn23.19:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.2:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.2:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.2:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called a ‘sentient being’.

sn23.2:1.4.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sattoti vuccatī”ti?
sn23.2:1.4.eng: How is a sentient being defined?”

sn23.2:1.5.pli: “Rūpe kho, rādha, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā, tatra satto, tatra visatto, tasmā sattoti vuccati.
sn23.2:1.5.eng: “Rādha, when you cling, strongly cling, to desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form, then a being is spoken of.
sn23.2:1.5.comm: Here the Buddha puns on satta from sajjati (“to cling”) with satta from √as (“to be”). To be is to cling.

sn23.2:1.6.eng: When you cling, strongly cling, to desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling …

sn23.2:1.9.pli: viññāṇe yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā, tatra satto, tatra visatto, tasmā sattoti vuccati.
sn23.2:1.9.eng: consciousness, then a being is spoken of.

sn23.2:2.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, rādha, kumārakā vā kumārikāyo vā paṃsvāgārakehi kīḷanti.
sn23.2:2.1.eng: Suppose some boys or girls were playing with sandcastles.

sn23.2:2.2.pli: Yāvakīvañca tesu paṃsvāgārakesu avigatarāgā honti avigatacchandā avigatapemā avigatapipāsā avigatapariḷāhā avigatataṇhā, tāva tāni paṃsvāgārakāni allīyanti keḷāyanti dhanāyanti mamāyanti.
sn23.2:2.2.eng: As long as they’re not rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for those sandcastles, they cling to them, dally with them, treasure them, and treat them as their own.
sn23.2:2.2.comm: The rare verb keḷāyanti (“dally”) is from √kīḷ (“play”).

sn23.2:2.3.pli: Yato ca kho, rādha, kumārakā vā kumārikāyo vā tesu paṃsvāgārakesu vigatarāgā honti vigatacchandā vigatapemā vigatapipāsā vigatapariḷāhā vigatataṇhā, atha kho tāni paṃsvāgārakāni hatthehi ca pādehi ca vikiranti vidhamanti viddhaṃsenti vikīḷaniyaṃ karonti.
sn23.2:2.3.eng: But when they are rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for those sandcastles, they scatter, smash, and destroy them with their hands and feet, making them unplayable.

sn23.2:2.4.pli: Evameva kho, rādha, tumhepi rūpaṃ vikiratha vidhamatha viddhaṃsetha vikīḷaniyaṃ karotha taṇhākkhayāya paṭipajjatha.
sn23.2:2.4.eng: In the same way, you should scatter, smash, and destroy form, making it unplayable. And you should practice for the ending of craving.

sn23.2:2.5.pli: Vedanaṃ vikiratha vidhamatha viddhaṃsetha vikīḷaniyaṃ karotha taṇhākkhayāya paṭipajjatha.
sn23.2:2.5.eng: You should scatter, smash, and destroy feeling …

sn23.2:2.7.pli: saṅkhāre vikiratha vidhamatha viddhaṃsetha vikīḷaniyaṃ karotha taṇhākkhayāya paṭipajjatha.

sn23.2:2.8.pli: Viññāṇaṃ vikiratha vidhamatha viddhaṃsetha vikīḷaniyaṃ karotha taṇhākkhayāya paṭipajjatha.
sn23.2:2.8.eng: consciousness, making it unplayable. And you should practice for the ending of craving.

sn23.2:2.9.eng: For the ending of craving is extinguishment.”

sn23.20:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.20:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.20:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, vayadhammo, vedanā vayadhammo, saññā vayadhammo, saṅkhārā vayadhammo, viññāṇaṃ vayadhammo.
sn23.20:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to fall.

sn23.20:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.21:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.21:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.21:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, samudayadhammo, vedanā samudayadhammo, saññā samudayadhammo, saṅkhārā samudayadhammo, viññāṇaṃ samudayadhammo.
sn23.21:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to originate.

sn23.21:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.22:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.22:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.22:1.5.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo, vedanā nirodhadhammo, saññā nirodhadhammo, saṅkhārā nirodhadhammo, viññāṇaṃ nirodhadhammo.
sn23.22:1.5.eng: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to cease.

sn23.22:1.7.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn23.23:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.23:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.23:1.3.pli: “sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yamahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto vihareyyan”ti.
sn23.23:1.3.eng: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”

sn23.23:2.1.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn23.23:2.1.eng: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.

sn23.23:2.3.pli: Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn23.23:2.3.eng: Form is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

sn23.23:2.4.pli: Vedanā māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…

sn23.23:2.5.pli: saññā māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…

sn23.23:2.6.pli: saṅkhārā māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…

sn23.23:2.7.pli: viññāṇaṃ māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…
sn23.23:2.7.eng: Consciousness is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

sn23.23:2.8.pli: yo kho, rādha, māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.
sn23.23:2.8.eng: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.”

sn23.24:1.1.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, māradhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo …pe….
sn23.24:1.1.eng: “You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is subject to Māra …”

sn23.33:1.1.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, samudayadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo …pe….

sn23.3:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn23.3:1.2.eng: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.3:1.3.eng: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the cessation of the leash to existence’.
sn23.3:1.3.comm: The bhavanetti is “that which leads to continued existence”. Early Sanskrit netrī always retains the expected grammatical sense, a noun from the root “to lead”, i.e. a “leader” (Rig Veda 1.113.4, 4.56.2, 5.50.2, 7.76.6, 7.77.2). Compare the English concept of the psychopomp or ferryman who leads you to the afterlife. Here, the commentary explains, “It is a name for craving. For by it beings are bound in their heart and lead on to life after life, like an ox tethered by the throat.” This suggests the sense of “lead” as in “leash”.

sn23.3:1.4.pli: Katamā nu kho, bhante, bhavanetti, katamo bhavanettinirodho”ti?
sn23.3:1.4.eng: What is the leash to existence? And what is the cessation of the leash to existence?”

sn23.3:1.5.pli: “Rūpe kho, rādha, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upayupādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā—
sn23.3:1.5.eng: “Rādha, any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies—

sn23.3:1.6.eng: this is called the leash to existence.

sn23.3:1.7.eng: Their cessation is the cessation of the leash to existence.

sn23.3:1.8.eng: Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling …

sn23.3:1.11.eng: consciousness; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies—

sn23.3:1.12.eng: this is called the leash to existence.

sn23.3:1.13.eng: Their cessation is the cessation of the leash to existence.”

sn23.34:1.2.eng: Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

sn23.34:1.3.pli: “sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yamahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto vihareyyan”ti.
sn23.34:1.3.eng: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”

sn23.34:2.1.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn23.34:2.1.eng: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.

sn23.34:2.2.eng: And what is liable to cease?

sn23.34:2.3.pli: Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…
sn23.34:2.3.eng: Form is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

sn23.34:2.4.pli: vedanā nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…

sn23.34:2.5.pli: saññā nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…

sn23.34:2.6.pli: saṅkhārā nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…

sn23.34:2.7.pli: viññāṇaṃ nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…
sn23.34:2.7.eng: Consciousness is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

sn23.34:2.8.pli: yo kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.
sn23.34:2.8.eng: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.”

sn23.35:1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ rādhaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
sn23.35:1.2.eng: When Venerable Rādha was seated to one side, the Buddha said to him:

sn23.35:1.3.pli: “yo kho, rādha, māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn23.35:1.3.eng: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.

sn23.35:1.5.pli: Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…
sn23.35:1.5.eng: Form is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it. …

sn23.35:1.6.pli: viññāṇaṃ māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo …pe…
sn23.35:1.6.eng: Consciousness is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

sn23.35:1.7.pli: yo kho, rādha, māro; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.
sn23.35:1.7.eng: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.”

sn23.36:1.1.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, māradhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo …pe….
sn23.36:1.1.eng: “You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is subject to Māra …”

sn23.45:1.1.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, samudayadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo …pe….
